meanings.sent1: She looked very depressed after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather made him feel depressed.
meanings.sent3: Even the cheerful puppy seemed a bit depressed on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent4: The wilting flowers in the garden appeared depressed under the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds cast a depressed mood over the entire town.

meanings.definition: Pressed down or lowered in position.
meanings.sent1: The depressed button on the machine needed to be fixed.
meanings.sent2: The depressed lever caused the door to close tightly.
meanings.sent3: The depressed lid on the box kept everything securely inside.
meanings.sent4: The depressed keys on the piano produced a softer sound.
meanings.sent5: The depressed area on the map indicated a lower elevation.

meanings.definition: Reduced in force, amount, or value.
meanings.sent1: The depressed prices at the store attracted many customers.
meanings.sent2: The depressed economy led to job losses.
meanings.sent3: The depressed interest rates made borrowing more affordable.
meanings.sent4: The depressed stock market caused investors to worry.
meanings.sent5: The depressed value of the antique vase surprised the owner.
